What are common errors you might encounter when running `./verusd` on a Linux distribution, and how can you resolve them?

When running `./verusd` on a Linux distribution, such as Debian or Devuan, you might encounter errors related to missing dependencies. Two common errors you might see are:
```
error while loading shared libraries: libgomp.so.1: No such file or directory
error while loading shared libraries: libz.so: No such file or directory
```
These errors occur because the required libraries, `libgomp` and `zlib1g-dev`, are not installed by default on your Linux distribution.

To resolve these errors, you need to install the missing libraries. You can do this by running the following command:
```
sudo apt-get install libgomp1 zlib1g-dev
```
This command will install the required libraries, and you should be able to run `./verusd` without encountering these errors.

# error while loading shared libraries: libgomp.so.1: No such file or directory
# error while loading shared libraries: libz.so: No such file or directory

When running `./verusd` on a Linux distro (eg Debian or Devuan), not all dependencies may be installed by default, resulting in the errormessage `error while loading shared libraries: libgomp.so.1: No such file or directory` or `error while loading shared libraries: libz.so: No such file or directory`.

To solve this you need to install the libgomp and zlib1g-dev libraries:
`sudo apt-get install libgomp1 zlib1g-dev`
